source: 211.org, United Way of Georgia, Georgia Department of Veterans Service, and partner organizations

resources.name: Georgia Department of Veterans Service
resources.address: 2 MLK Jr Drive SE, Atlanta, GA 30334
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive veterans benefits, field services, education programs, healthcare, and support for veterans and their families. Operates state veterans homes and memorial cemeteries.

resources.name: 211 Georgia (United Way)
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential helpline connecting individuals to community resources including housing, food, healthcare, employment, disaster relief, and veteran-specific services. Operates through local United Ways.

resources.name: VA Atlanta Healthcare System
resources.description: Major VA medical center serving Georgia veterans with 21+ clinics statewide. Specializes in health care teams experienced in veteran-focused medicine, mental health care, and services for homeless veterans.

resources.name: Connecting Georgia Veterans
resources.description: Nonprofit providing rapid-response support to struggling veterans throughout Georgia. Services delivered within days, not weeks. Originally Connecting Cobb Veterans, expanded statewide in 2024.
resources.leadership: Tyler Bowser (Program Director), Irene Barton (Executive Director)

resources.name: VETLANTA
resources.description: Premier destination for Atlanta veterans to live, work, play and pray. Connects veterans with each other and assembles resources while driving collaboration across nonprofits, companies, government agencies, academia, and community.

resources.name: GA VECTR (Georgia Veterans Education Career Transition Resource Center)
resources.address: 1001 S. Armed Forces Blvd, Warner Robins, GA 31088
resources.description: Resource center dedicated to helping veterans transition from military to civilian careers through education, training, and support services. Access to Georgia's 28 public universities and 22 technical colleges.

resources.name: Catholic Charities Atlanta - Veterans Services
resources.address: 2305 Parklake Drive, Suite 150, Building 9, Atlanta, GA 30345
resources.description: Catholic Charities provides comprehensive case management and benefits assistance to veterans and their families, with staff who are veterans or have extensive military experience. 200 veteran families assisted annually.
resources.mailing_address: 2401 Lake Park Drive, SE, Smyrna, GA 30080

north_peachtree_location.address: 3669 North Peachtree Road, Suite 100, Atlanta, GA 30334

resources.name: HOPE Atlanta (Supportive Services for Veteran Families)
resources.address: 458 Ponce de Leon Ave. NE, Building B, Terrace Level, Atlanta, GA 30308
resources.description: SSVF provider serving 30+ counties in Georgia. Provides rapid re-housing and wraparound services to veterans and families experiencing or at-risk of homelessness.
eligibility: Currently homeless or at imminent risk

resources.name: Project Community Connections, Inc. (PCCI) - Veteran Services
resources.address: 302 Decatur St. SE, Suite 101, Atlanta, GA 30312
resources.description: Provides Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) to help veterans and families experiencing homelessness achieve rapid re-housing and self-sufficiency.

crrc_location.name: Community Resource & Referral Center (CRRC)
crrc_location.address: Fort McPherson, Building 129, 1701 Hardee Ave SW, Atlanta, GA 30310

resources.name: Cherokee County Homeless Veterans Program
resources.address: Canton Post 45, 160 McClure Street, Canton, GA 30114
resources.description: Registered 501(c)(19) nonprofit providing support to homeless veterans in Cherokee County. Offers emergency assistance with housing, food, and creative programs to help veterans rebuild their lives.
services: recreational activities (fly fishing, aquarium visits, photography club)

resources.name: Operation Appreciation
resources.description: 501(c)(3) nonprofit providing emergency humanitarian support and recreational programs for Georgia soldiers, veterans, and their families. Operates Red, White, and Bear Cabin retreat for disabled veterans.

resources.name: Veterans Empowerment Organization (VEO)
resources.description: Provides housing solutions, medical care, and job readiness support to veterans. Offers both temporary and permanent housing programs for low-income and homeless veterans.

resources.name: Georgia Veterans Service Foundation
resources.description: Nonprofit organization with mission 'Serving Those Who Have Served' providing support to Georgia veterans.

resources.name: 211 Connecting Point
resources.description: Community Connection Specialists connect veterans and families with resources they need for food, housing, employment, healthcare, and emergency services. Available 24/7, free and confidential.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line - National
resources.description: Free, confidential 24/7 crisis support for veterans experiencing suicidal thoughts, substance abuse, homelessness, or other emotional crises.

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: Nationwide hotline for veterans who are homeless or at imminent risk of becoming homeless. Connects to local VA resources and support services.

resources.name: United Way of Greater Atlanta - 211
resources.description: Local United Way providing searchable database of services and trained specialists for veteran referrals in Atlanta and surrounding areas.

notes: This resource list includes state government agencies, federal VA services, nonprofits, and community organizations serving Georgia veterans. Services include housing assistance, mental health care, employment support, food assistance, and veterans benefits navigation. Most services are free or low-cost. Veterans experiencing housing insecurity or crisis should contact 211, their local VA center, or the Veterans Crisis Line (988 Press 1) for immediate assistance.
